definition[0]: if something unpleasant such as a fire, fight, or war breaks out, it starts to happen
example[0]: I was still living in London when the war broke out.
example[1]: Does everyone know what to do if a fire breaks out?
example[2]: Fighting broke out between demonstrators and the police.
example[3]: Three men have broken out of a top-security jail.
definition[2]: to change the way you live because you feel bored
example[4]: She felt the need to break out of her daily routine.
definition[3]: if you break out in spots etc, they appear on your skin
example[5]: I broke out in a painful rash.
example[6]: My whole body broke out in a sweat.
